Package com.leakyabstractions.result.assertj Description

Provides assertions for Result type.

AssertJ assertions for Result

If you think some assertion is missing, please create an issue or even better contribute!

Result Library for Java is hosted on GitHub.

To quickly start using Result assertions, follow these steps:

  1. Statically import com.leakyabstractions.result.assertj.ResultAssertions.assertThat.
  2. Pass the result under test as the sole assertThat parameter.
  3. Use code completion to discover assertions.

Statically import assertThat

 import static com.leakyabstractions.result.assertj.ResultAssertions.assertThat;

Pass the result under test as the sole assertThat parameter

 assertThat(result)

Use code completion to discover assertions

Use your preferred IDE code completion after assertThat to discover and call assertions. 


     @Testpublic void should_pass() {
         // Given
         final int number = someMethodReturningInt();
         // When
         final Result<String, Integer> result = someMethodReturningResult(number);
         // Then
         assertThat(number).isZero();
         assertThat(result).hasSuccess("OK");
     }
Author:
Guillermo Calvo

ResultAssertions, Result
